posts.subject: Blue Planet Synthesis Paper for United Nations Environment Programme (2012)
posts.body:
Environment and Development Challenges:  The Imperative to Act (2012)

"This paper is a synthesis of the key messages from the individual papers written by the BluePlanet Laureates (Annex I describes the Blue Planet Prize), and discusses the current andprojected state of the global and regional environment, and the implications for environmental,social and economic sustainability."

"The human ability to do has vastly outstrippedthe ability to understand.  As a result civilization is faced with a perfect storm of problems driven by overpopulation, overconsumption by the rich, the use of environmentally malign technologies,and gross inequalities. They include loss of the biodiversity that runs human life-support systems, climate disruption, global toxification, alteration of critical biogeochemical cycles, increasing probability of vast epidemics, and the specter of a civilization-destroying nuclear war. These biophysical problems are interacting tightly with human governance systems, institutions, and civil societies that are now inadequate to deal with them."
EU Copyright Directive Article 13 unofficial final text. (resulting from the finished trilogue in February 13, 2019)
posts.subject: Article 13 final text from finished trilogue Feb. 2019
EU copyright directive final text (2019)
posts.body: Final text of whole EU copyright directive (2019)
Logic behind EU Copyright directive article 13 (February 2019) for website owners

this law (copyright directive) was approved in final EU parliament vote 26 March 2019. It have to be approved by one more vote by member states which is expected to to approve it nearly certainly. Then the directive should be implemented roughly within 2 years by member states, it is important member states implementations minimize negative impacts of the link tax and upload filters.
